title: Riot, what is Illaoi's 'Strategic Niche'
body: I love Illaoi and love playing as her, but I can't figure this out

replies.body: In practice, Illaoi is a duelist whose ability to win duels depends on her opponents making mistakes, rather than herself making outplays.  She's weak in a teamfight, as a split pusher, in securing objectives, and just in general.
So like old Darius

> [{quoted}](name=Jelly Mac,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uUUnmJeO,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-02-29T22:25:06.436+0000)
>
> So like old Darius

Eh. Old Darius was _fun_ though. And honestly, I liked him more.
I'd compare her more to Old Heimer/Yorick in terms of feel.

Illaoi's intended to be a juggernaut (high sustained damage, mainly short range, low mobility, high tankiness, low CC) who:

* Helps her team, other low mobility champs especially, get extended dps time on a target (E)
* Brings some zone control if she can set up before a fight (tentacle spawning)
* Goes well with wombo combo comps (R in particular)
I personally feel like she isn't quite tanky enough - even in a tentacle nest she squishes pretty easy.  But she's a ton of fun to play.

She has tankiness the problem is her flaws, she's the weakest champ only cause her strength and tankiness are locked behind major exploitable flaws.

At least minimally they fixed CC interrupts illaoi's ulti putting it on full cd and not working.
sad thing is that she's certainly on the tankier side of things...
Welcome to Season 6. That's a little taste of what non-armor titan tanks feel like right now.
I'd like to disagree here, just played against an Illaoi that was nearly impossible to kill, with less than three of us andn she usually killed at least one. She build {{item:3748}} {{item:3071}}
Is she up for any balance changes?

I use to love her when she first came out, made it mastery 5 in a day... ppl didn't knew how to play against her so it made it easy.... now, people literally just walk away when you try to fight them... Even if you got a good 3+ man ult out, people just simply dash out, flash out, walk out... now your useless until you can ult again.
The sad part is, you suppose to go top, with tp, and when bot or mid needs you, you tp... leaving all your tentacles up top... when you arrive at your destination you have NO damage because you left all your tentacles at top.(this part i dont understand.. because nagakabouros should follow {{champion:420}} ... It's her god ffs)  (more tentacles = more damage) .... now your just smacking people down until a tentacle is spawn... which they simply just walk out... 

a nice solution for her would be:

once you ult.. how ever much tentacles you spawn will spawn in a radius around you, which move with you until the duration of the ult.

that's just my few cents

I feel like her passive should have some sort of "tentacle count" that goes up to like 5 or something, and as you move around the map they change position to follow you.

I don't know she just needs a way to bring her tentacles with her because as it is she is worthless when not near her tentacles, and she has no way to keep people near them.

So true. You can't keep em unless you have a 3+ man ult {{champion:32}}  or {{champion:3}}  or {{champion:59}}  ... the dream... those players come so far in between.

She doesn't seem to struggle with range much.
I wouldn't really consider Darius low CC. He has a ranged displacement with a massive slow, on top of another massive slow, which, on a squishy, is basically death, which is the best CC in the game.
her strategic niche is aram

She's a pick oriented juggernaut. She lacks CC and is countered by kiting, but has a high priority single target grab that enables you to fight while an enemy is severely hindered or removed from the fight.
She also excels in team fights in her zone, like Heimer (but better).  If she can set a zone up before a fight, she's golden.
Her and Galio ulting is probably a scary Wombo.
Illaoi top, Galio support, MF adc, Kennen mid, WuKong jungle.
Ven diagram of Death.
Mate, have you seen the Galio mid?
Seen it?  I've played it numerous times.  Got rank 5 on him, mostly mid with some supp.  I personally prefer Galio as a mid, but in the case of Kennen vs Galio mid, Galio goes supp.

Problem is setting up a "tentacle zone" takes upwards of 30 seconds, and any ranged champion can easily clear them from safety.

I think they should make it so you clear the tentacles by standing on them like a Rek'Sai tunnel that way ranged champions can't just clear her tentacles out and make her worthless.

My only complaint about Illoai is the bugs

Her W and E are really buggy

That and it takes 3s for her combo to actually do any damage.  In some fights she is dead by then.

Juggernaut with massive AOE damage but no CC and no initiation. Able to curse opponents and delay recalls or force awkward movements due to threat of being whacked by a tentacle even when away from battle.

However she is a bit too much like Darius before his rework. Very oppressive in lane but completely useless in teamfights against anyone smart enough to simply walk away from her. She is also too dependent on her opponents not knowing how her kit works, like how basic attacks on her reduce the spirit duration or to kill the tentacles whenever possible.

I really want to like her as she is the type of champion I love to play, but her lack of utility and unreliable damage just makes her too much of a gamble

She's the champ you pick for all in yolo.

She has a garbage early/mid game.

But if you have a heavy siege all in comp you're guaranteed a win later on once you group.

She strategically pacifies tumblr hate mobs from forming. Half-Jokes aside, I don't know what they were thinking with her.

Everything about her screams pacifying those types of people and her kit is just bland with some uninteractive unit generation. Like they just wanted to push her out cause it was the current year. She looks terrible, her lore is shoehorned in to the overall story, her kit can't be strong without being toxic, and her voiceover is oppressive.
